item.title: What the Sony hacks tell us about their Sysadmins and management
item.description: {% raw %} I wouldn't want to be a Sony sysadmin right now. F-Secure just blogged about evidence of a fourth hack at the electronics giant. This one is relatively harmless - a phishing scam being run from Sony servers - but this pattern of security problems should tell us a few things about Sony's SysAdmin staff: 1) They're powerless in their own organization. 2) They don't get to set IT resource policy.
